author: rhuijben
msg: Remove the relative paths from the file and directory batons in the update
editor. This also allows removing the relative anchor from the edit baton.
(edit_baton): Remove anchor and rename target to target_basename.
(make_dir_baton): Don't initialize path and update target reference.
(add_directory): Compare abspaths, and use abspaths in error messages.
(close_directory): Use absolute paths, and remove another access baton.
(apply_textdelta): Use absolute path for error message and loggy.
(close_file): Use abspath in notify and error message.
(make_editor): Don't set anchor in edit baton.

author: gstein
msg: Get rid of the "rerun" concept. Every operation should be able to be run
multiple times, and it shouldn't matter whether it is the FIRST or an
(file_xfer_under_path): if the source/destination doesn't exist, then
don't throw an error. simply assume that something else removed the
file for a reason and exit quietly. remove the RERUN param.
(log_do_file_readonly): if the file doesn't exist, then assume it was
removed for a reason, and don't throw an error
(log_do_modify_entry): rip out the section testing for a removed entry
on a re-run. the behavior should not change. if code deletes an entry
(log_do_committed): revamp the get_entry() and rerun testing logic.
specifically, the entry will always be present, so we don't need to
test for that. adjust some of the related commentary.
(run_log): remove the RERUN parameter and its storage into the

author: danielsh
msg: In svn-rep-sharing-stats, use (char *) instead of (void *) to store the
(pretty_print):  Extract the reference count the new way.

author: danielsh
msg: New.  Errors out unless an environment variable is set.
